head.citation-title: 23rd International Conference on Neural Information Processing, ICONIP 2016
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 296 papers. The special focus in this conference is on Time Series Analysis, Data-Driven Approach for Extracting Latent Features from Multi-dimensional Data, Topological, Graph Based Clustering Methods, Reinforcement Learning, Computational Intelligence, Data Mining and Deep Neural Networks. The topics include: Chaotic feature selection and reconstruction in time series prediction; deep belief network using reinforcement learning and its applications to time series forecasting; yet another schatten norm for tensor recovery; combining deep learning and preference learning for object tracking; nonnegative tensor train decompositions for multi-domain feature extraction and clustering; approximate inference method for dynamic interactions in larger neural populations; features learning and transformation based on deep autoencoders; parcellating whole brain for individuals by simple linear iterative clustering; collaborative-based multi-scale clustering in very high resolution satellite images; new clustering algorithm for dynamic data; risk sensitive reinforcement learning scheme is suitable for learning on a budget; sparse kernel-based least squares temporal difference with prioritized sweeping; performance of qubit neural network in chaotic time series forecasting; artificial bee colony algorithm based on neighboring information learning; memetic cooperative Neuro-evolution for chaotic time series prediction; pattern retrieval by quaternionic associative memory with dual connections; a GPU implementation of a bat algorithm trained neural network; semi-supervised classification by nuclear-norm based Transductive label propagation; factorization of multiple tensors for supervised feature extraction; unsupervised video hashing by exploiting spatio-temporal feature and stacked robust autoencoder for classification.
